abstract: Decision by University of Massachusetts Amherst to ban Iranian nationals from certain science and engineering programs has sparked anger and complaints; policy, set up to comply with federal law that established new sanctions against Iran for its nuclear weapons program, is revised after backlash in community; still, many Iranian students and those who sympathize with them question need for any policy, as law does not explicitly call on universities to carry out its enforcement.
lead_paragraph: A decision by the University of Massachusetts to follow through on a law that bars Iranian students from some science and engineering programs sparked fury, consternation and accusations of discrimination.

headline.main: Sanctions Put Academic Freedoms to a Test on a Campus Far From Tehran
headline.print_headline: Sanctions Put Academic Freedoms to a Test on a Campus Far From Tehran

snippet: A decision by the University of Massachusetts to follow through on a law that bars Iranian students from some science and engineering programs sparked fury, consternation and accusations of discrimination.
